OK, so I'm still a bit hosed because my surt prefix (meant to mimic
path scope) prevents the site's robots.txt file from being read, and
then I get a ream of exceptions.

I had to put the surt prefix in a separate file,

http://(com,voanews,www1,)/Persian/

And made the single seed

http://www1.voanews.com/Persian/

I set "seeds-as-surt-prefixes" to false.

Problem java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException occured when trying to process 'http://www1.voanews.com/robots.txt' at step ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR

Associated Throwable: java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException

  Stacktrace:
java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException
        at org.archive.io.RecordingInputStream.readFullyOrUntil(RecordingInputStream.java:186)
        at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.innerProcess(FetchHTTP.java:327)
        at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:102)
        at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:273)
        at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread. java: 143)

If I don't put the SURT prefix in a separate file but in with the
seeds, the job "completes" immediately with no log messages, no
alerts, no nothing that I can find.

I tried adding "robots\.txt$" to the 'additionalScopeFocus/regexp'
field, but that didn't help.

Guess I'll stick with the path scope for the time being.

    -tree
